alert.note: Alert for Magoffin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 02 at 3:56PM EST until January 02 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Licking River near Salyersville affecting Magoffin County. For the Licking River...including Salyersville, Morehead...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Licking River near Salyersville. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water inundates one lane of Kentucky Highway 1090 in a few places near Lakeville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EST Sunday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested but will continue to run high through late this evening. - Action stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued 8 pm.
